content.description:
WALKING ON AIRETE 5.11a * (80') M (3b)

The arete formed by the left edge of "The Phil" dihedral. Begin as for that route with the lower crack, then step left onto the arete and climb to the cold shut anchors. Sustained with good variety.
content.location:
The arete formed by the left edge of "The Phil" dihedral.

A 100' rap will get you to the mid-face anchors from Broadway if you just want to toprope.

content.description:
WAITING FOR THE PHIL 5.10b/c (PG) (2 pitches) G

This is the obvious finger crack to squeeze chimney to off-width crack/dihedral right of the central arete.

Climb the crack. A long 1st pitch to above the main off-width, with a short 2nd pitch was how it was originally climbed, but another option is to break into 2 halves and use the top anchors of "Walking on Airete" as a hanging belay. Or just climb it in one pitch.

Cruxes low and high; a serious trad route - watch out for loose flakes!
content.protection: Trad, a full range of gear needed.
content.location:
This is the obvious finger crack to squeeze chimney to off-width crack/dihedral right of the central arete.

Walk off to the east.

content.description:
SUNRISE REDEEMER 5.10c ** (145') M (6b)

A fine moderate route up the flakes and slab between Cocody Rock and the "Riding the Sturgeon" arete. Begin at the base of the left facing corner at the left edge of the big flakes. From the top of the flake climb the more difficult bolted face above, exiting at the gap on the right of the huge roof. Long sling and gear needed for top anchor.
content.protection: Mixed, 6 bolts, and a selection of nuts for the lower corner, and top belay.
content.location: Climbs the middle of the face left of Cocody Rock (below the huge roof). Walk off to the east.

content.description:
STEPPIN' UP 5.11a/b *** (35') F (5b)

Climbs the outer face of Cocody Rock. Very short, but consistently challenging up excellent rock. One of the valley's best.

Originally this route had only 3 (hand-drilled) bolts, now there are 5 to lessen the danger of a ground fall by a short climber.
content.protection: Fixed 5 bolts to the 2 rap anchors.
content.location: On Cocody Rock which is the semi-detached massive boulder at the far right end of Morning Rock. Best approached by a short scramble from the left along the base of the main cliff (small ladder installed in the approach crack).

content.description:
STEPPIN' OUT 5.7 * (2 piches) G

P1 (90', 5.7) - Begins to the left of Cocody Rock and climbs the squeeze chimney behind Cocody Rock to the top of the flake. From the top of the flake step up onto the face above (a hard crux for a short climber). Belay on the lower end of Broadway beside the large fir tree.

P2 (100', 5.6) - The 2nd pitch goes up the slab and through the headwall above on good holds (past the Serviceberry bush) to belay at the trees above - try protecting this pitch using only slings!
content.protection: Gear, a range of small to medium nuts and a few long slings.
content.location:
At the right end of the East face to the weakness at the left end of the upper roof.

Walk off to the East.

content.description:
STEPPIN' IN 5.10a ** (30') G

In the middle of the short wall below Cocody Rock climb the prominent clean hand crack.
content.protection: gear - variety of medium to large sized.
content.location: On the south facing wall below Cocody Rock at the far right side of Morning Rock.

content.description:
RIDING THE STURGEON 5.11b/c ** (150') M (8b)

In the middle of the SE Face take the thin right hand crack/left facing corner through the middle blocky roof to the upper arete (finishing right of the crest). A great sustained climb needing small to medium gear and a big sling for the top anchor.
content.protection: mixed - 8 bolts, small to medium gear and a big sling on top.
content.location: Climbs the cracks and arete in the middle of the face. Walk off to the east.

content.description:
IN WATERMELON SUGAR 5.11d * (150') M (2b)

Climb the left side, long straight thin crack in the middle of the east Face. Steep and thin, this is a hard gear route that shares some bolts and the upper arete (and top belay) with "Riding the Sturgeon".
content.protection: A wide range of small to medium cams and nuts. Long sling needed for top belay.

content.description:
FALL FROM GRACE 5.12 * (90') M (6b)

At the left end of the East face, begin on the face between the 2 aretes. At the top of the first crack hand traverse right on the crystal holds to reach the upper right crack. Climb this with tenacity to where it eases, joining "Walking on Airete" for the last bolt. A fine sustained route with a great mid section beginning with the very devious traverse! Small and medium cams are needed.
content.protection: Mixed, 6 bolts plus a selection of small to medium cams
content.location: the blank lower face right of the main arete to the next arete on the right.
